case_theme: 2. Exploring the Future Without a Change in the Other
background: Jack feels unfairly targeted and embarrassed by a teacher in front of the class.
pre_reasoning: Exploring the client's perspective and emotions is crucial in Solution-Focused Brief Therapy.

dialog.observation: Therapist expresses interest in Jack's experience.

dialog.text: He does this every time. The whole class can be talking and screwing around while he is out of the room. When he comes back, who does he yell at, and kick out? Nobody else but me. He says with my grades I can’t afford to be screwing around. He just embarrasses me in front of the whole class. I wish I could embarrass him a few times. I wish I could get out of that class.
dialog.observation: Jack feels targeted and humiliated by the teacher's actions.

dialog.text: Hmmm. What are you going to do?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist prompts Jack to consider his options and future actions.

dialog.text: I don’t know, he’s such a jerk. He just decided the first day that he didn’t like me and now he is after me every chance he gets. He should retire. He’s too old to be teaching.
dialog.observation: Jack perceives the teacher negatively and feels unfairly treated.

post_reasoning: Exploring Jack's feelings of being targeted and embarrassed by the teacher is essential in Solution-Focused Brief Therapy. By understanding Jack's perspective and emotions, the therapist can help him explore potential solutions and coping strategies for the situation.
